Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(2) Summary

The idea of looking at your organization as a single coherent system is tempting, but is it realistic? If it isn't, what does that mean for software developers, and how can we make discoverable what we are developing? This talk looks at organizations as ecosystems rather than as systems, and asks what that difference means for software development. It all boils down to focusing on software as components implementing business capabilities, and how to best capture these capabilities and make them findable and useful as reusable components.

(7) Distributed Systems



Systems and Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(8) Decentralized Systems



Systems and Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(9) Distribution? Decentralization? Does it matter?

  • No centralized control on how to build components
  • Heterogeneous practices driven by constraints
  • No centralized view of all contributions
  • Differing levels of experience/effectiveness of contributors
  • Different roles and focus on supporting their success

API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(17) API Users



API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(18) Lesson #1: Expand Your API Horizon

  • APIs are products and should be designed with consumers in mind
  • Public/Partner API: Establish and/or drive new value streams
  • Private API: Become better at changing value streams effectively


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(19) API Platforms



API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(20) Lesson #2: Plan for API Diversity

  • Different user groups need different APIs
  • For API consumers it shouldn't matter how/where an API is implemented


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(21) Platform Architecture



API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(22) Lesson #3: Architect an Open Platform

  • APIs can be contributed from various environments
  • APIs can be published to various consumers/environments


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(23) Building Block Mechanics



API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(24) Lesson #4: What's an API's Value?

  • Describing the technical interface is necessary but not sufficient
  • APIs have to be readily consumable products


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(25) Building Block Value



API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(26) Lesson #5: WIIFM

  • The true measure of success is how much value is created
  • Make it easy for people to understand the business value of your API

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations

(34) Building Building Blocks

  • As developers we are building (digital) building blocks
  • Building blocks have to be useful and usable
  • Usefulness is a function of the business value of a capability
  • Usability is a function of how easily the capability can be used


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Development and Discovery in Large-Scale Organizations
